author: christine_dkim
content:
Hey all, I hosted a community call on Glamsterdam earlier today and wanted to share a quick summary on what was discussed and follow-ups: 
- Fiddy from Lido expressed support for some kind of slot pipeline restructuring in Glamsterdam to pave the way for slot shortening in future upgrades. He noted that while he is generally supportive of ePBS for the restructuring, there's still much about the specifications that don't seem finalized, so he stressed the need for more clarity on the latest design of ePBS. 
- Jerome from EthCC + home staker expressed support for 6 second block times as a way to improve UX and shared his support for how the EF and devs are doing more for this fork to get feedback from the community. 
- Both had really good things to say about the Forkcast tool and how that's a gamechanger for aggregating community views.
- I'm hosting a follow-up community call after next Thursday's ACDE to discuss any decisions coming out of that call related to Glamsterdam. If devs want to join in for this one and have extended discussion on Glamsterdam with other community members, please do! https://x.com/i/spaces/1YqxooDERoExv
- Full recording of today's call: https://x.com/christine_dkim/status/1948020381031223492

author: .paulharris
content:
Listening back to ACDE, it sounded like we're saying release, 30 days before first testnet for the audit etc, but that now implies we're looking at nearly 3 months of time between finishing dev and getting to mainnet...
It worries me more than a little when we're looking at that much time for testnet deployment, especially given the drive for 6 month release cycles.
I guess explainer, 
release + 30 days -> first testing
2 weeks -> second testnet
30 days -> mainnet
adds to 2.5 months, so with that amount of time, i rounded up.
Is that understanding correct?
